docs.snippet: Peter Thiel, who has drawn fire from fellow tech executives for supporting Donald J. Trump, plans to address the issue in a speech this month.

headline.print_headline: How Tech Leaders Treat a Trump Backer
headline.main: How Silicon Valley Treats a Trump Backer: Peter Thiel

docs.abstract: Investor Peter Thiel, who caused outrage in Silicon Valley with his $1.25 million gift to Donald J Trump's campaign, will defend himself in speech in Washington; episode highlights how Trump is anathema to tech investors and entrepreneurs.

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton says her "heart breaks" for the family of a man from Lebanon living in Oklahoma who police say was fatally shot by his neighbor.

headline.print_headline: Clinton Says Her 'Heart Breaks' for Slain Tulsa Man's Family
headline.main: Clinton Says Her 'Heart Breaks' for Slain Tulsa Man's Family

docs.snippet: A web-sifting exercise that helps students of all ages figure out how facts or fakery flow online.

headline.main: An Exercise to Sift for Sources Amid a Blitz of Fake News

docs.abstract: A web-sifting exercise that helps students of all ages figure out how facts or fakery flow online.

docs.snippet: She was rooting for Yale, he for Harvard, but they put those differences aside.

headline.main: Vina Pulido and Anthony Nguyen: Putting Aside a Harvard-Yale Rivalry

docs.snippet: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.
docs.abstract: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.

docs.snippet: In their probing, sardonic commentary on Silicon Valley’s broken promises, artists have begun to sound an alarm that we might not be ready to hear.

headline.print_headline: Finding Inspiration for Art in the Betrayal of Privacy
headline.main: Finding Inspiration for Art in the Betrayal of Privacy

docs.snippet: Edgar M. Welch of North Carolina was charged after a shooting at a Washington pizzeria that he thought was harboring young children as sex slaves.

headline.print_headline: Fake News Brought Real Guns in Washington Pizzeria Attack
headline.main: In Washington Pizzeria Attack, Fake News Brought Real Guns

docs.abstract: Edgar M Welch is arraigned in Washington court for shooting up Comet Ping Pong pizzeria with assault-like AR-15 rifle, which he claims he did because he believed restaurant to be headquarters of child-trafficking ring; shooting underscores lasting power of fake news, as number of stories alleging restaurant was involved in child-trafficking circulated on social media, despite being debunked repeatedly by legitimate news outlets.

docs.snippet: Thailand's military government urged people not to take the law into their own hands on Monday after three videos surfaced on social media of angry mobs accusing people of insulting the monarchy following the death of King Bhumibol Adulyadej.

headline.print_headline: Thai Junta Urges Restraint After Crowds Mob Royal Insult Suspects
headline.main: Thai Junta Urges Restraint After Crowds Mob Royal Insult Suspects

docs.snippet: The officers stopped Anis Amri, the Tunisian man wanted in the Berlin truck attack. One officer was shot; another had been on the job for just nine months.

headline.main: Italy Lauds 2 Officers as Heroes in Fatal Shooting of Fugitive

docs.snippet: Voters do want to know the truth. They just want it to agree with them.
